channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: ‘Just stop the war,’ al-Shifa doctor says on the situation in Gaza
item.description: 'I stay here to help our people': A doctor in Gaza talks to Marc Lamont Hill about its health crisis.

item.title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy signs new army draft law to boost conscription
item.description: Law obliges men to update their draft data, increases payments to volunteers and adds new punishments for draft dodging.

item.title: Israeli airstrike hits crowded Gaza refugee camp
item.description: An Israeli airstrike on the Maghazi refugee camp in central Gaza killed at least 11, including children.

item.title: Venezuela shuts diplomatic office in Ecuador to protest Mexico embassy raid
item.description: Speaking at a summit of regional states, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro denounces raid as an 'act of barbarism'.

item.title: UN demands Israeli forces end support of settler attacks in West Bank
item.description: UN spokesperson says Israel has a duty to protect Palestinians from settler attacks, which have been on the rise.

item.title: Hezbollah commander killed in Israeli drone strike in Lebanon
item.description: Hezbollah and the Israeli army confirm a commander of the armed group was killed in a drone strike in southern Lebanon.

item.title: ‘Human shields on the battlefield’: Myanmar forces Rohingya into military
item.description: Forced conscription into the military is the latest tactic Myanmar’s military-led government is using against Rohingya.

item.title: Russia’s Putin urges restraint in call with Iran’s Raisi as tensions soar
item.description: Russian president makes comments as Israel weighs its response to Iranian missile and drone attack.

item.title: Three key talking points entering the NBA Eastern Conference playoffs
item.description: Can anyone best Boston, is this the Knickerbockers' year and what impact will Joel Embiid have on the East postseason?

item.title: Israel artist says Venice Biennale pavilion won’t open until Gaza ceasefire
item.description: An artist representing Israel at the international art fair calls for an immediate ceasefire in Israel's war on Gaza.

item.title: Photos: Israeli tanks push back into northern Gaza, warplanes hit Rafah
item.description: Palestinian health officials say Israel killed four people and wounded several others in one attack in Rafah.

item.title: Aerial rescues in Oman save dozens from flash floods
item.description: Aerial rescues in Oman have saved at least 75 people, some who were swept up and carried away by flash floods.

item.title: Muslim pupil loses UK court bid over Michaela school prayer rituals ban
item.description: Student took legal action against London school, saying policy was discriminatory and 'uniquely' affected her faith.

item.title: It is time for a democratic world order
item.description: US threats to states that take action on Gaza must compel them to form a coalition and collectively resist.

item.title: Armenia claims Azerbaijan ‘completed’ ethnic cleansing in Nagorno-Karabakh
item.description: Azerbaijan systematically 'erasing' all traces of ethnic Armenians in the disputed region, Yerevan says.

item.title: Global day of action over Gaza war
item.description: Pro-Palestine protesters shut down the Golden Gate bridge as part of a global day of action over Israel’s war on Gaza.

item.title: Insurance firms should shun the East African Crude Oil Pipeline
item.description: The project is already devastating local communities and will contribute to climate change if completed.

item.title: Why direct action is becoming common in the fight for the Palestinian cause
item.description: From blocking bridges to economic boycotts, direct action for Gaza is increasingly common. But can it succeed?

item.title: Is Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant at risk of an ‘accident’?
item.description: Global powers raise alarm after latest drone attack on Russian-held nuclear facility hits reactor confinement structure.

item.title: Ukraine warns it lacked missiles to protect power plant from Russian attack
item.description: The Trypilska thermal power station, a major electricity supplier to Kyiv region, was destroyed by missiles on April 11.

item.title: Mass grave discovered at Gaza hospital occupied by Israeli forces
item.description: A new mass grave was found at al-Shifa Hospital where a two-week siege by Israeli forces has turned it into a graveyard.

item.title: Paris 2024 torch lit in Olympics birthplace, relay under way
item.description: The torch relay for the Paris 2024 Olympics has begun at the birthplace of the games in Greece.

item.title: India election 2024: Which are the main political parties in the fray?
item.description: More about Modi's BJP, Rahul Gandhi's Congress and other parties that are central to world's largest electoral exercise.

item.title: Heavy rains kill 18 in Oman as flash floods lash UAE
item.description: Rescue teams search for two missing people in Oman as bad weather disrupts travel in the United Arab Emirates.

item.title: ‘We share with rats’: Neglect, empty promises for S African hostel-dwellers
item.description: Built to house a male workforce under apartheid, hostels are now overcrowded, decaying and largely ignored by the state.
